entry.title: Matt Fisher & Cody Subido - The Friend Ship

media:group.media:title: Matt Fisher & Cody Subido - The Friend Ship
media:group.media:description:
Subscribe to The Berrics üëâhttp://bit.ly/TheBerricsYoutube
I don't think these two have ever met, but since they both skate so differently, I thought having them share a part would be really rad. There's nothing like some good old fashioned juxtaposition to keep things interesting. So this is for you, tech dudes. And this is also for you, gnar dogs. There's even something for you, jazz fan. I hope you all enjoy it!

Tyler "Squints" Imel made his first appearance on The Berrics in the REDirect series. As Jon Holland's unique subject, Squints was a prime example of a skater out there doing it for the right reasons. Four years later, and after a Bangin, a street part, and a three-part RADAR series (and another part), Squints is still doing his thing.

entry.title: Etnies Gives Back: 2018 | Easter L.A. Mission Shoe Giveaway

media:group.media:title: Etnies Gives Back: 2018 | Easter L.A. Mission Shoe Giveaway
media:group.media:description:
Subscribe to The Berrics üëâhttp://bit.ly/TheBerricsYoutube
Last Sunday, the etnies team held their annual shoe giveaway event in LA's Skid Row, the downtown area where most of the city's missions and homeless charities are based. Since 1998, the company has handed out free pairs of Soletech shoes to those who need them most. With etnies team riders, along with head honchos Don Brown and Pierre-Andre Senizergues, handing out nearly 50,000 pairs over the past two decades, the annual #EtniesGiveBack event continues to be a proud moment for skateboarding.

media:group.media:description: Aaron breaks the rules and we back that. He couldn't just choose one, but we bet the two he chose aren't who you would've guessed!

entry.title: Ryan Lay's 102 Trick Line Narrated By Ted Barrow

media:group.media:title: Ryan Lay's 102 Trick Line Narrated By Ted Barrow
media:group.media:description: This week, instead of roasting your Instagram skatepark submissions, Ted Barrow (AKA @feedback_ts) wanted to take on the ambitious task of narrating Ryan Lay's 100+ trick line that CCS dropped last week. If you don't think you have the attention span, think again. You'll breeze right through it with plenty of laughs and grunts. Seriously though, Ryan... this is insane! And please let Ted know what kind of pants those are.

media:group.media:title: SkateHoarders: NHS Factory
media:group.media:description: Jeff Kendall takes us on a trip through time in part of the NHS offices and factory. No shortage of nostalgia (or history) here‚Äîfrom old ads to graphics that never ran, original screens, one-offs, old Indys and even the first-ever Santa Cruz board... Sit back, settle in and enjoy the tour that only scratches the surface of this factory of treasures. If you ever get a chance to visit this place, do it.

media:group.media:title: 411VM - Issue #1
media:group.media:description: In celebration of April 11th (4/11), here's the issue that started it all, 411VM #1 (Jul/Aug '93)---the "Extra Fat Premier Issue." We have a ton of new 411 gear dropping on our online store this week too... Keep those eyes peeled.

media:group.media:title: old earth
media:group.media:description:
Since November, the threads idea vacuum California chapter have been releasing old earth, an Instagram series featuring Alex Schmidt, Jordan Mccollough, Chris Athans, Darius King, John Lindsay, Max Garson, Logan Taylor, Mike Bloodsworth, Jared Burke, Trevor Thompson and more. The old earth master timeline is all of the raw footage from all of Instagram edits in one place.
Filmed and edited by Chris Thiessen.

Yo Yo is the complete package: He's funny, charismatic, has style for days and skates his ass off! I Hope everyone enjoys his part and be on the look out for much more from my whoadie!‚ÄîP-Rod Guest tricks from Diego Najera, Paul Rodriguez, and Jake Darwen. entry.title: Brutally Honest Reviews Of Your Best Instagram Clips With Ted Barrow (Episode 7)

media:group.media:title: Brutally Honest Reviews Of Your Best Instagram Clips With Ted Barrow (Episode 7)
media:group.media:description:
You send them, he reviews them! Here‚Äôs another compiled batch of Ted‚Äôs critical reviews of your Instagram clips for one reason and one reason only‚Äîbecause YOU want him to! Side note: These reviews in particular are specific for our YouTube page, so you won't see these floating around on the gram. Don't be scared... send Ted your clips.
About Ted Barrow AKA @feedback_ts: @feedback_ts is one our favorite Instagram follows. He's a New York skater that has built up quite a following by having kids submit their videos to his account for an honest and sometimes brutal critique; occasionally a positive review is posted...occasionally. With no shortage of willing submissions, Ted's dry and witty delivery can be polarizing to some and may be an acquired taste to others, but we love it. We're going to bring you a weekly dose of some our favorite roasts of his in this mini-montage for your viewing pleasure. And if you're brave enough, you should submit your clips to him via his "link in bio" instructions (@feedback_ts) and see if you can make it through the gauntlet unscathed.
Interview with Ted: https://skateboarding.transworld.net/features/interview-ted-barrow-aka-feedback_ts/

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: The Whole Reason: Pitcher Park Memorial Skatepark

media:group.media:title: The Whole Reason: Pitcher Park Memorial Skatepark
media:group.media:description:
This is a story of a mother on a mission to memorialize the lives of her sons Vincent and Stephen Pitcher. A rectification for the stereotyping and incrimination her sons experienced doing what they loved. A groundbreaking achievement for a hard-fought battle. The building of a skatepark.
Website: http://www.pitcherpark.com

media:group.media:title: HOAX MFG - Volume 1
media:group.media:description:
Hoax MFG is a skater-owned clothing brand founded in Santa Cruz, California in 2009. Their vision came from the idea that life is all just a Hoax...whether it's the government, corporate run media, or other peoples' expectations on what a successful. Instead of sitting idly by and being told what to consume, we decided to take a stand, speak our message, and make clothing the way they want to, with graphics from skater artists all around the world. that's the first video Hoax MFG Volume 1
